data.text:
Introduce your child to the world of mystery with this collection of Sherlock Holmes books for kids! This includes classic stories and modern adaptations, perfect for inspiring critical thinking & problem-solving skills in young readers.

These classic detective stories, written by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, have captivated readers for over a century and are perfect for encouraging a love of critical thinking and problem-solving in young readers.

That's why we've put together this comprehensive guide to some of the best Sherlock Holmes books for kids. Have them join Sherlock and Dr. Watson on thrilling adventures – start solving cases today!

Table of Content

Modern Adaptations of Sherlock Holmes for Older Kids

Additional Sherlock Holmes Books for Kids

Classic Sherlock Holmes Books for Kids

One of the great things about Sherlock Holmes books for kids is that they provide a fun and engaging way to introduce children to the world of detective work and mystery solving. As they follow along with Sherlock and Dr. Watson on their adventures, kids will learn to pay attention to detail, make observations, and use logical reasoning to solve mysteries. These skills are not only valuable in the world of detective work, but also in everyday life.

Another benefit of Sherlock Holmes books for kids is that they can help to promote reading and literacy. Reading is an important skill that helps to build vocabulary, improve comprehension, and enhance critical thinking skills. By providing kids with engaging and entertaining material to read, parents can encourage a love of reading that will last a lifetime.

1. Sherlock Holmes: The Complete Novels and Stories (Volume One), by Arthur Conan Doyle

This collection of short stories is a great introduction to the world of Sherlock Holmes for children. It includes 12 stories featuring the world-famous detective and his faithful biographer and partner-in-crime, Dr. John Watson. The short stories include favorites like The Red-Headed League, Scandal in Bohemia and The Adventure of the Speckled Band as well as one of his most famous novels The Hound of the Baskervilles. These classic stories are sure to captivate young readers and introduce them to the brilliant deductive reasoning of Mr. Sherlock Holmes.

Amazon Rating: 4.6

2. Sherlock Holmes: The Complete Novels and Stories (Volume Two), by Arthur Conan Doyle

These two volumes contain all fifty-six short stories and four novels featuring Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s world-famous detective - Sherlock Holmes. Volume II contains the fourth of the Sherlock Holmes novels, The Valley of Fear, in which Holmes memorably faces his archenemy, Professor Moriarty.

The celebrated short stories included are The Adventure of Wisteria Lodge, The Adventure of the Red Circle, The Adventure of the Devil's Foot, The Adventure of the Sussex Vampire, and His Last Bow: The War Service of Sherlock Holmes plus many more!

Amazon Rating: 4.7

3. The Sherlock Holmes Collection (Arcturus Collector's Classics)

This beautiful box set includes Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes stories collected in six volumes. The tales from one of the most iconic characters in fiction will entertain readers today just as much as when they were first published in the late 19th Century. Stories include: 1. Adventures of Sherlock Holmes 2. The Hound of the Baskervilles & The Valley of Fear 3. His Last Bow 4. The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes 5. The Return of Sherlock Holmes 6. A Study in Scarlet & The Sign of Four

Amazon Rating: 4.7

4. The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes (Penguin Clothbound Classics)

This collection coincided with the major motion picture release Sherlock Holmes starring Robert Downey, Jr., and Jude Law. The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes is a spine-tingling treat for anyone who loves a classic whodunit!

This gripping collection includes many of the famous cases that made the leg­endary Sherlock Holmes one of fiction's most popular characters, together with his devoted secretary, Dr. Watson. It includes The Adventure of the Blue Carbuncle, The Adventure of the Speckled Band, The Adventure of the Engineer's Thumb and many more!

Amazon Rating: 4.7

5. The Hound of the Baskervilles: 100th Anniversary Collection

This is perhaps the most famous Sherlock Holmes story of all, and it's perfect for kids who love a spooky mystery!

When Sir Charles Baskerville is found dead on the moors near his family's ancestral home, Sherlock is called in to investigate. Could it be the work of a legendary supernatural hound? With the help of Dr. Watson and their keen observation skills, Sherlock sets out to solve this mystery and bring the culprit to justice.

Amazon Rating: 4.7

Introducing Sherlock Holmes to Younger Kids

One thing to consider when choosing a Sherlock Holmes book for your child is their age and reading level. Some of the classic Sherlock Holmes stories may be more suitable for older or more advanced readers, while modern adaptations or graphic novels may be more accessible for younger or less experienced readers. It's important to find a book that is challenging but not too difficult for your child, as this will help to keep them engaged and motivated to read.

Another thing to consider is the type of mystery or detective work that your child is interested in. Some Sherlock Holmes books focus more on crime solving, while others delve into the supernatural or science fiction. Consider your child's interests and choose a book that aligns with those interests to help keep them engaged and invested in the story.

No matter which Sherlock Holmes book you choose for your child, be sure to encourage them to ask questions, make observations, and use logical reasoning to solve the mystery along with Sherlock and Dr. Watson. This will help to further develop their critical thinking and problem-solving skills and make the reading experience even more engaging and rewarding.

13. Sherlock Academy (Sherlock Academy Series)

Sherlock Academy is a mystery and detective series for middle readers(ages 8-12) that takes place in the heart of London on the famous Baker Street.

Rollin E. Wilson and his friends are mysteriously chosen to attend the Academy and start their first year at school by arriving in a hansom cab. They must de-code their class schedule. The library rearranges itself. The teachers are all specialists in Sherlockian crime solving methods. There’s classes in codes and disguises, among others.

Amazon Rating: 4.4

14. The Case of the Missing Marquess by Nancy Springer

In this mystery, young Enola Holmes (Sherlock's little sister) sets out to solve the disappearance of her mother. Along the way, she encounters a variety of colorful characters and uses her own detective skills to solve the case. With the help of her brother Mycroft and her own keen observations, Enola proves that she's more than a match for the world's best amateur detective. Be sure to check out the Netflix adaptation!!

Amazon Rating: 4.6

16. The Daughter of Sherlock Holmes Mysteries, #1

From USA Today and internationally bestselling author Leonard Goldberg comes The Daughter of Sherlock Holmes, a new thrilling tale of the great detective’s daughter and her companion Dr. John Watson, Jr. as they investigate a murder at the highest levels of British society.

"Cleverly crafted with fascinating characters and a plot that Conan Doyle would be proud of. Sherlock fans looking for a new series need look no further than Goldberg's well developed and fascinating tale!" ―M.J. Rose, New York Times bestselling author

Amazon Ratings: 4.4

20. The Great Sherlock Holmes Puzzle Book:

A Collection of Enigmas to Puzzle Even the Greatest Detective of All!

Pit your wits against the greatest detective of them all with this collection of over 130 fiendish and hugely entertaining puzzles and enigmas. Some involve riddles, some plays on words, and some rely on mathematical principles. Use your powers of logical deduction, and see if you can match the towering intellect of Sherlock Holmes.

Amazon Ratings: 4.5

21. Sherlock Holmes Escape Room Puzzles:

Written by an experienced escape room creator, Sherlock Holmes Escape Room Puzzles can be enjoyed either on your own or played as a group. The story spans from the well-known 221B Baker Street, across the dark and dangerous streets of Victorian London... and beyond. There are a wide variety of puzzle types, including both traditional puzzles on the page and more interactive puzzles that may involve paper-crafting.

Amazon Ratings: 4.5
